briefTitle: Comparison of 2 Beta Blocker Drugs on Peripheral Arterial Disease in Patients With High Blood Pressure
officialTitle: Effect of Nebivolol Compared With Metoprolol in Hypertensive Patients With Peripheral Arterial Disease
summary: This is a 26-week, prospective double-blind, randomized pilot trial of nebivolol versus an active control, metoprolol succinate, in patients with established lower-extremity peripheral artery disease, hypertension, and at least moderate risk for coronary artery disease.

primaryOutcome.timeFrame: Baseline PWT is measured at the time of enrollment and again at the final study visit at 26 weeks.
